stationery.name: Pilot G-2 0.7mm in Black.
stationery.det: Low profile pen with a subtle gold imprint. Good ink flow, useful for drawing outlines.
stationery.origin: Purchased in bulk from a department store.

stationery.name: Pilot FriXion Ball Erasable Gel Ink Pen in Purple.
stationery.det: Erases easily (albeit leaves behind some grey residue) with less than decent ink flow. Great colors for purple collectors, however!

stationery.name: Daiso Design Knife No.115.
stationery.det: Not used often but very handy. A precision knife is very nice to have in your back pocket. I still prefer larger blades, of course!

stationery.name: Daiso Touch (Stylus) Pen.
stationery.det: Broke the stylus bit rather quickly. Sports a large hollow body; a good place to store things!

stationery.name: Bic Mechanical Pencils.
stationery.det: A reliable generalist... Mostly because there's so many of them.
stationery.origin: Purchased in bulk & many picked up from a floor somewhere or borrowed and promptly forgotten.

stationery.name: Bic 4-Color Ballpoint Pen
stationery.det: Rather loud but boasts decent color quality. A veteran of my (high) school days. Surprisingly still works like new!

stationery.name: Pentel RSVP FINE in Black.
stationery.det: Clear mid-sized pen with a dry, lightweight ink flow that grew on me. One of my go-to sketch utensils.
stationery.origin: Purchased in bulk from a department store.

stationery.name: Paper Mate InkJoy Gel Pen 0.7mm in Black.
stationery.det: Reliable heavyweight inker with a stunning body. A go-to for traditional drawings.

stationery.name: Paper Mate Flair Scented Pens
stationery.det: Reliable felt-tip pens that you can definitely smell (and they the artificial kind of good, like condensed flavoring) even after all these years. They're also labeled with their respective scents! Remember to swatch; these colors are deceiving.

stationery.name: Crayola Fine Line Markers
stationery.det: Classic Crayola quality in a pretty black barrel. Only used on rare occasion and hold up well after many years. I believe these are the 'adult' markers but I'm not sure. Very easy to lose (since there are so many). Remember to swatch!

music.name: Furi OST
music.det: Stumbled upon this gem and can't get enough of it. This album may have been a catalyst for my obsession with similar sound.

music.name: Outer Wilds: Echoes of the Eye
music.det: Found this after (while?) watching an Outer Wilds playthrough. Best listened to with your eyes closed and mind open.

music.name: Blue Prince OST
music.det: Found this after watching a Blue Prince playthrough. It is downright evil how majestic this album's music is!!! I listened to this nonstop for days... What am I saying, that was definitely worthwhile.

music.name: Superliminal OST
music.det: Unbelievably smooth vibes for a VDG. If you're down to mellow out, check it out! Clouds (Pause Menu) is my go-to track—yes, I like elevator music, and yes, I have a dedicated playlist!

music.name: toe - グッドバイ (Goodbye)
music.det: Breaches the confines of soul. Unites the mind and spirit. Just feel. Watch the music video on their channel if you connect with the music!

music.name: SEATBELTS - Piano Black
music.det: Composed, unruly sound, like the birdsong of a mechanical underground orchestra. Yeah, I'm not good with words so just go see what I mean ww!!!

music.name: Cosmo Sheldrake
music.det: What feels like rustic origins melted and molded into a mystical fable by artisanal hands. Analyzing and memorizing the lyrics to karaoke the songs is a grand old time.

music.name: A Bird's Last Look
music.det: Brief but an instant classic. I really don't know what I'm talking about; have a listen if you're intrigued?

music.name: Susumu Hirasawa - Gats
music.det: An obligatory addition.

music.name: Milkoi & Miraie - The Place You Promised To Show Me
music.det: A resonant orchestral piece. You'll be seeing a lot of these kwk

music.name: funnyflipper - pathetic dog christmas ornament
music.det: Pathetic dogs always have a place on this website ww. Ok let's be serious, this is good stuff. Keep staring at the dog. Don't. Look. At. The. Dog. JK lol!!!

music.name: Namitape
music.det: Exactly as the website explains: dreamy, nostalgic, synthpop music with vocaloids. Sure, I have no clue what the lyrics mean, but the flow ridiculously addictive~ Also, visit the website—it's really cool!

music.name: Vincent Diamante
music.det: Composer of majestic and airy music that breathes life into the likes of (the games) Sky:COTL and Flower.

music.name: Radiohead - No Surprises
music.det: Surprised? No, not a chance... right? The MV is incredible by the way!

music.name: Rkz
music.det: Probably in my top 5 ambient artists list (I don't keep track (you caught me, I'm lazy)) and for good reason!

music.name: Jamiroquai - Virtual Insanity - Remastered 2006
music.det: What can I say? Bangers are bangers.

music.name: Max Duggan
music.det: Colorful, airy and beautiful melodies. I recommend Reflections of Mini Metro (mostly because that's how I found this artist... and I listen to this album the most)!

music.name: Paradis - Garden Le Pour Toi
music.det: You know when you can't help but dance? The vibes are good with this one.

music.name: The Beatles - Hey Jude
music.det: Legendary song with incredible karaoke potential. ...Don't look at me like that, I told you I'm not a music expert!!

music.name: Alexandre Desplat - The French Dispatch
music.det: I was so enamored with this album on my first go-through that I listened to almost half Desplat's discography, but I haven't listened to all the Wes Anderson scores yet!

wallpaper.name: Inspirobot - BYCBLASS
wallpaper.det: [OFFENSIVE] Active volcano in the background with a moody atmosphere. Then you look up and see... that.

wallpaper.name: Inspirobot - EIAS
wallpaper.det: [OFFENSIVE] Abstract geometry (specifically triangles). I'd consider it colorful contemporary with slightly playful text.

wallpaper.name: Inspirobot - SHMCYH
wallpaper.det: [OFFENSIVE] Sleek red and black abstract geometry with a four-pointed star as its focal point. Well, that would be the case if not for the unavoidable question front and center. I especially like the text variation in this :)

wallpaper.name: Inspirobot - YAAPB
wallpaper.det: [NOT REALLY OFFENSIVE] Classic gorgeous outlook at a purple and peach sky from a plane. The bold red on the wing really adds some life to this... as does the easily overlooked text ww.

wallpaper.name: Inspirobot - YAAAC
wallpaper.det: [NOT REALLY OFFENSIVE] Super clean blue and red gradation over a black backdrop. The very silly text ties it all together.

wallpaper.name: Wessex Poems and Other Verses - Page 49
wallpaper.det: Grayscale illustation of a landscape with an incredible composition. Obscure finds are the best~

wallpaper.name: James Crowe Richmond
wallpaper.det: Landscapes in watercolor. New Zealand nature focus.

wallpaper.name: MS Paint / hand-drawn
wallpaper.det: I found this to be a good time, but understand that I like MS Paint.... and Comic Sans. The messier the result, the better!

wallpaper.name: Mu Pan
wallpaper.det: Intensely violent and overflowing with kinetic energy. At least, that's how I see his work... I'm bad with words ww. Large epic paintings, China mythos focus.

wallpaper.name: Caspar David Friedrich - Wanderer above the Sea of Fog
wallpaper.det: Powerful composition and color contrast. Considered the visual face of The Sublime for a reason~

wallpaper.name: Albert Bierstadt A Storm in the Rocky Mountains (collection)
wallpaper.det: Views from the heart of the Rocky Mountains with a mature tone, as if, say, a storm were brewing.

eats.name: Tangyuan
eats.det: Delicate rice balls with filling (sesame paste by default)—an auspicious classic. Try it with black sesame seed soup!

eats.name: Steamed Eggs
eats.det: Super soft, melts-in-the-mouth formula that can be perfected with just a few additions. Personally, I enjoy the base flavor~

eats.name: Mixed Texture Noodles
eats.det: Specifically wavy ramen and straight rice noodles due to their unique qualities! The textures really make a difference. Also, this may or may not be an innuendo :9

eats.name: Udon
eats.det: Some noodles have the ability to revive a soul. Sure, I'm exaggerating, but I think udon could cure a hangover easy.

eats.name: Acai Juice
eats.det: This stuff is so good I portion my drinking amounts (yes, just juice, nothing else) such that one bottle lasts me a month. After all, good things shouldn't be taken for granted!

eats.name: Ice
eats.det: Great to chew on. Ice/Ice.

eats.name: Parfait
eats.det: All forms of parfait are mouth-watering; even the ones that are still partially frozen make my mouth sing!

eats.name: Pomegranate
eats.det: Deceptively easy to eat and also stunning to look at.

eats.name: Fish
eats.det: I lean towards the seafood-fiend side of food personalities thus naturally I find fish (no sides) delicious! Best eaten lightly cooked!

eats.name: Oranges
eats.det: Like watermelons it's difficult to find a good orange but it's a very worthwhile venture for those who like citrus.

eats.name: Pretzels
eats.det: Tasty whether soft-baked or in snack form! Honestly if I had the time I'd probably have a soft-baked pretzel at every offering establishment I visit.

eats.name: Smart Food White Cheddar Popcorn
eats.det: My dislike for popcorn and fondness of white cheddar comes together in a very inconsequential matrimony through this. Yeah, it's pretty good.

eats.name: Tater Tots and Hash Browns
eats.det: So I couldn't decide between the two ultimate potato foodstuffs since they're both amazing, so what???!?!!?

eats.name: Brownies
eats.det: Classic dessert I would hate to turn down. Like many things, tastes better with a homemade touch~

eats.name: Cornbread
eats.det: I find it ridiculous that something as good as cornbread is so overlooked and then I remember it's bread. Trust me though, it is good.

eats.name: Cold/Green Salad
eats.det: The more one-note the meat, the better. Man, if salads weren't so expensive things would be very different—I can say that since I've tried making salads at home.

eats.name: Applesauce
eats.det: Say what you will but at least I'm true to my tastes...

eats.name: Baked Beans
eats.det: So tasty but so, so calorie dense :(

eats.name: Broccoli Cheddar Soup
eats.det: All soup is good soup! I just happen to like this one a little more.

eats.name: Chinese Bakery Pastries
eats.det: You know the ones. If you don't, goodness you're missing out! Those bakery goods are delectable~

eats.name: Bean Sprouts
eats.det: Work with every dish and have the same effect as sunflower seeds (to me at least).

eats.name: Corn
eats.det: Classic food that complements most dishes. Personally hard to come by thus it's even more valuable!!

eats.name: Ice Breakers
eats.det: Dunno, just really like the flavors. The Duo mints are really nice too.

eats.name: Dry Ramen
eats.det: Either uncooked ramen or purpose-made dry ramen snacks. Both are good!

eats.name: Pringles
eats.det: Probably the best chips out there. Also, tall cans >>>

eats.name: Saltines
eats.det: Not flavor heavy and that's why I like 'em... No, saltines are actually delicious. I could eat saltines forever.

eats.name: Macaroni n' Cheese
eats.det: Mmm.

eats.name: Stacy's Pita Chips
eats.det: I usually have these without hummus only because I normally don't have hummus stocked. Still good chips!

eats.name: Thin Mints and Thin Mints Bites
eats.det: I'm a sucker for mint chocolate (FYI my go-to ice cream flavor is mint choco) and these are evil they're so good!!!

eats.name: Dill Pickles
eats.det: Paired with the occasional sub. Perhaps the best part of ordering a sub is having friends that offer their pickles.
